meanings.definition: To allow someone to participate in an activity or use a service again after being banned.
meanings.sent1: The online game moderator decided to unban the player so they could join the game once more.
meanings.sent2: After understanding their mistake, the library decided to unban the student from borrowing books.
meanings.sent3: The restaurant owner accidentally banned a regular customer but quickly unban them with an apology.
meanings.sent4: In the world of magic, the wizard's spell could unban anyone from entering the enchanted forest.
meanings.sent5: The judge's decision to unban the protester from the courthouse was met with relief and gratitude.

meanings.definition: The act of lifting a ban on someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The unban of the student from the school dance brought joy to their classmates.
meanings.sent2: The government's official announcement of the unban on public gatherings was welcomed by the citizens.
meanings.sent3: The unban on using cell phones during class made the students very happy.
meanings.sent4: The unban on fireworks in the city led to a colorful and festive celebration.
meanings.sent5: The unban on pets in the apartment complex made many residents smile with excitement.
